Author: howunfortunate_
Text: i dont know where you live but when i told my gp i had an ED he referred me to a decent therapist w experience in EDs. and as the other person said eds come w their own set of health issues that can come up, so theyre better off being aware to treat you keeping that in mind (like when they give you medication and such)

Author: bulimicomrade
Text: Telling your gp is a good idea because it affects other areas of your health. For example, when I got the depo shot my gynecologist said that she wouldn't have given it to me if I still had an ED because it decreases your bone density (that was when I was still in recovery). There are other aspects of your health that your gp handles that will be impacted by it, so it's best if it's on your record.
